snippet: In the case in which a teenage driver fleeing the police killed a 4-year-old girl on a sidewalk, some are weighing whether the officers should have chased him or allowed him to get away.
abstract: Death of 4-year-old bystander Ariel Russo following police pursuit of teenage driver Franklin Reyes in Upper Manhattan raises questions of whether officers should have chased suspect or allowed him to get away; balancing act is common dilemma for police departments nationwide.
lead_paragraph: In the case in which a teenage driver fleeing the police killed a 4-year-old girl on a sidewalk, some are weighing whether the officers should have chased him or allowed him to get away.

headline.seo: Doubts Linger After a Fatal Police Pursuit
headline.main: After a Police Pursuit Ends Fatally, Doubts Arise Over the Decision to Give Chase
headline.print_headline: After a Police Pursuit Ends Fatally, Doubts Arise Over the Decision to Give Chase
